DataElement.preferredName: Dynamic International Prognostic Scoring System Intermediate Risk 2 Or High Risk Disease or Disorder Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not Dynamic International Prognostic Scoring System intermediate risk 2 or high risk disease or disorder was present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dynamic International Prognostic Scoring System Intermediate Risk 2 Or High Risk Disease or Disorder Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A system of prognostic categorizations for myelodysplasia syndrome that evaluates disease progression over time based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Dynamic International Prognostic Scoring System Intermediate Risk Integer::2 Or High Risk Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A system of prognostic categorizations for myelodysplasia syndrome that evaluates disease progression over time based on a combination of: percentage of blast cells in the bone marrow, the presence and severity of specific cytogenetic abnormalities, and the number of cytopenias in the peripheral blood.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A time-dependent risk evaluation system for primary myelofibrosis that evaluates disease progression over time. This model includes age older than 65 years, hemoglobin level lower than 10 g/dL, white blood cell count more than 25x10^9/L, peripheral blood blasts equal to or higher than 1%, and constitutional symptoms in order to assign a patient to one of 4 risk categories.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is moderate.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
